description: The AWS::Timestream::Database resource creates a Timestream database.

Tag.description: You can use the Resource Tags property to apply tags to resources, which can help you identify and categorize those resources.

Key.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 128  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.markdownDescription:
You can use the Resource Tags property to apply tags to resources, which can help you identify and categorize those resources.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

DatabaseName.description: The name for the database. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the database name.
DatabaseName.markdownDescription:
The name for the database. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the database name.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]{3,256}$  
Update requires: Replacement

KmsKeyId.description: The KMS key for the database. If the KMS key is not specified, the database will be encrypted with a Timestream managed KMS key located in your account.
KmsKeyId.markdownDescription:
The KMS key for the database. If the KMS key is not specified, the database will be encrypted with a Timestream managed KMS key located in your account.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 2048  
Update requires: No interruption

Tags.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.
Tags.markdownDescription:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

Arn.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption
